descriptions.description: More core developers increase the availability of mentors, facilitating implicit knowledge transfer.
A larger pool of potential mentors attracts more newcomers to join the project as contributors.
As new contributors skill up, they move out of the 'New Contributors' stock into more experienced roles.
Developer turnover directly reduces the number of core developers by their departure from the project.
Promoting experienced contributors directly increases the stock of core developers.
The promotion rate decreases the stock of experienced contributors as they move into core roles.
The skill up flow increases the number of experienced contributors as newcomers gain proficiency.
Better documentation and guides accelerate learning, increasing the rate at which contributors skill up.
Effective mentorship accelerates practical learning, thereby increasing the skill up rate.
Mentorship helps experienced contributors develop the competencies needed for promotion to core roles.
